title: export-to-figshare would fail to cleanup for dataset with subdatasets
body:
Tried on some test dataset laying around:

```shell
(git-annex)lena:/tmp/testds[master]git
$> git status
On branch master
nothing to commit, working tree clean

$> datalad export-to-figshare
[INFO   ] Exporting current tree as an archive under /tmp/testds since figshare does not support directories 
[INFO   ] Uploading /tmp/testds/datalad_None.zip to figshare 
Article
Would you like to create a new article to upload to?  If not - we will list existing articles (choices: yes, no): yes

[INFO   ] Created a new (private) article 11845443 at https://figshare.com/account/articles/11845443. Please visit it, enter additional meta-data and make public 
[INFO   ] 'Registering' /tmp/testds/datalad_None.zip within annex                                                                                                                                                                  
[INFO   ] Adding URL https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/21708819 for it 
[INFO   ] Registering links back for the content of the archive 
[INFO   ] Adding content of the archive /tmp/testds/datalad_None.zip into annex <AnnexRepo path=/tmp/testds (<class 'datalad.support.annexrepo.AnnexRepo'>)> 
[INFO   ] Initiating special remote datalad-archives 
[INFO   ] Finished adding /tmp/testds/datalad_None.zip: Files processed: 2, removed: 2, +annex: 2 
[WARNING] Removing temporary directory under which extracted files were annexed and should have been removed: /tmp/testds/.dataladw4a0msxt 
CommandError: command '['git', 'rm', '--force', '-r', '--', '.dataladw4a0msxt']' failed with exitcode 128
Failed to run ['git', 'rm', '--force', '-r', '--', '.dataladw4a0msxt'] under '/tmp/testds'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: pathspec '.dataladw4a0msxt' did not match any files

fatal: pathspec '.dataladw4a0msxt' did not match any files

$> datalad subdatasets
subdataset(ok): d0/d1/r0 (dataset)

```
That was with datalad 0.12.2 and then reproduced with 0.12.2.dev117

NB didn't check if actually export itself exported that subdataset properly
